result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus D Perea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus D Perea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS with 5 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but is not eligible the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 years probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 months condition time. STRAIGHT TIME. Court stayed the commencement. Defendant to report by 07/31/2015 at 5:00pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights have been restored.  

Court is opposed to expungement

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Sentencing Referral Form
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant checked in and received new court date of 05/26/2015 at 1:30pm for plea hearing in Branch 22.

Defense requests another plea hearing date due to scheduling conflicts.  Attorney Darryl Smith is taking over case for Attorney Eric Vega.  05/12/2015 remains a calendar call for defendant to report to court, plea hearing is moved to 05/26/2015 at 1:30pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."    Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court, defendant Jesus D Perea not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant missed court on 03/20/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 03/24/2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Eric M. Vega in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jesus D Perea in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.   Karine O'Byrne Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/16/15 @ 1:30pm
